content.text:
REFERENCES
Byrne, J. H. (1980). Quantitative aspects of ionic conductance mechanisms
contributing to firing pattern of motor cells mediating inking behavior in Aplysia
californica. J. Neurophysiol. 43: 651-668.
Connor, J. A., and Stevens, C. F. (1971). Voltage clamp studies of a transient outward
current in gastropod neural somata. J. Physiol. 213, 21-30.
Covarrubias, M. J., Wei, A., and Salkoff, L. (1991). Shaker, Shal, Shab, and Shaw
express independent K current systems. Neuron 7: 763-773
Deal, K. K., Lovinger, D. M., and Tamkun, M. M. (1994). The brain Ky1.1 potassium
channel: in vitro and in vivo studies on subunit assembly and posttranslational
processing. J. Neurosci. 14: 1666-1676.
Dubois, J. M. and Rouzaire-Dubois, B. (1993). Role of potassium channels in
mitogenesis. Prog. Biophys. Mol. Biol. 59: 1-21.
England, S. K., Uebele, V. N., Kodali, J., Bennett, P. B., and Tamkun, M. M. (1995a). A
novel K+ channel B-subunit (hKvß1.3) is produced via alternative mRNA
splicing. J. Biol. Chem. 270: 28531-28534.
England, S. K., Uebele, V. N., Shear, H., Kodali, J., Bennett, P. B., and Tamkun, M. M.
(1995b). Characterization of a voltage-gated K' channel B subunit expressed in
human heart. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA 92: 6309-6313.
Heinemann, S. H., Rettig J., Wunder F., and Pongs O. (1995). Molecular and function
characterization of rat brain Kyß3 potassium channel subunit. FEBS Lett, 377:
383-389.
Hille, B. (1991). lonic Channels of Excitable Membranes (Sunderland, Massachusetts.
Sinauer Associates.)
Hoshi, T., Zagotta, W. N., and Aldrich, R. W. (1990). Biophysical and Molecular
Mechanisms of Shaker Potassium Channel Inactivation. Science 250: 533-538
LI, M., Jan, Y. N., and Jan, L.Y. (1992). Specification of subunit assembly by the
hydrophilic amino-terminal domain of the Shaker potassium channel. Science
257: 1225-1230.
Liu, 1. I. and Gilly, W. (1995). Tissue Distribution and Subcellular Localization of
Na“ Channel mRNA in the Nervous System of the Squid, Loligo opalescens.
Receptors and Channels 3: 243-254.
